Key Findings

  • £5.8 million paid to Capita Business Services Ltd — Rossendale's largest commercial supplier by value
  • Capita provides outsourced council services in a role similar to Liberata's contracts at Burnley and Pendle
  • Represents approximately 9% of Rossendale's total £64M spend
  • Companies House compliance analysis pending — further due diligence needed on contract terms

Capita's Role at Rossendale

Capita Business Services Ltd is the largest commercial supplier to Rossendale Borough Council, receiving £5.8 million over the published data period (April 2021 to December 2025). The company provides outsourced council services, handling back-office functions that would otherwise be delivered by in-house staff.

This outsourcing model mirrors arrangements at neighbouring councils. Burnley and Pendle have long-standing contracts with Liberata UK Ltd for revenues, benefits, and other administrative services. Rossendale's choice of Capita — one of the UK's largest outsourcing firms — places it within a national pattern of councils delegating core functions to private-sector providers.

Capita at a National Level

Capita plc is a FTSE-listed company with annual revenues exceeding £3 billion. It holds contracts across UK central and local government, including major IT and business process outsourcing deals. The company has faced scrutiny over service quality on several high-profile public sector contracts nationally.

For a small district council like Rossendale (population approximately 70,000), the £5.8 million relationship with a company of Capita's scale raises questions about negotiating leverage. Smaller councils often lack the procurement expertise to negotiate complex outsourcing arrangements on equal terms.

The East Lancashire Outsourcing Picture

CouncilOutsourcing PartnerApproximate Value
RossendaleCapita Business Services Ltd£5.8M
BurnleyLiberata UK Ltd£21.2M
PendleLiberata UK Ltd£12.4M
HyndburnVariousN/A

While Rossendale's Capita contract is smaller in absolute terms than the Liberata deals at Burnley and Pendle, this partly reflects Rossendale's smaller overall budget. As a proportion of total spend, the dependency is comparable.

Questions for Further Investigation

Several questions remain unanswered from the published spending data alone:

  • Contract terms: When was the Capita contract awarded, what is its duration, and was it competitively tendered?
  • Performance metrics: How does the council measure whether the outsourced services deliver value for money?
  • In-house comparison: Has the council assessed whether bringing services back in-house would be more cost-effective, as Burnley is now doing with Liberata?
  • Companies House compliance: Full analysis of Capita's corporate filings against payment dates has not yet been completed

With Local Government Reorganisation on the horizon in Lancashire, all outsourcing contracts will need to be reviewed as part of any transition to a new unitary authority structure.

Methodology: Supplier spending figures are derived from Rossendale Borough Council's published spending data (April 2021 to December 2025, 42,536 transactions, £64M total). Comparisons with neighbouring councils use equivalent published datasets. Companies House compliance analysis is pending.
